content:
tonight  
I contemplate having the rowdy ambulances,  
looking for fodder on the outskirts of town,  
stop here, for a change, right in my fucking living room,  
where I implode under the coffee table  
waiting for the everything inevitable,  
the imminent death of whatever we've done.  
  
i write, sometimes, but mostly it comes out  
as modernist screams. i carry a notebook,  
i do what i can, and yet remain stuck in the difference  
the infinitely dividable gaps between objects  
and language, and language and I  
  
who am i, to crawl into your arms like this?  
to lay the issue out in hermeneutical crying  
  
  
there is this story i misheard from the soviet union  
about a poet being arrested after a party  
their body being dragged in a car  
shouting to their friends, wailing on the curb  
'no! do you not understand the beauty  
of being arrested for writing about love?'  
  
and i wonder what will happen when finally i am arrested  
will i scream, and struggle to, in one line  
give meaning to someone else's survival  
or will i go into my own mind  
and sit there  
and sing.
